 649+ C96E
 650+ C96E
 651+ C96E 2A 23 29 27  FighterTypeMapping:     DB ShipID_Worm, ShipID_Sidewinder, ShipID_Viper, ShipID_Thargon
 652+ C972
 653+ C972              ; Initialiase data, iyh must equal slot number
 654+ C972              ;                   iyl must be ship type
 655+ C972              ;                   a  = current bank number
 656+ C972 01 22 00     UnivInitRuntime:        ld      bc,UBnKRuntimeSize
 657+ C975 21 3F C0                             ld      hl,UBnKStartOfRuntimeData
 658+ C978                                      ZeroA
 658+ C978 AF          >                        xor a
 659+ C979 32 59 C0                             ld      (UBnKECMCountDown),a
 660+ C97C 77           .InitLoop:              ld      (hl),a
 661+ C97D 23                                   inc     hl
 662+ C97E 10 FC                                djnz    .InitLoop
 663+ C980              .SetEnergy:             ldCopyByte EnergyAddr, UBnKEnergy
 663+ C980 3A 05 C4    >                        ld       a,(EnergyAddr)
 663+ C983 32 58 C0    >                        ld       (UBnKEnergy),a
 664+ C986 FD 7C        .SetBankData:           ld      a,iyh
 665+ C988 32 3F C0                             ld      (UBnKSlotNumber),a
 666+ C98B C6 46                                add     a,BankUNIVDATA0
 667+ C98D 32 40 C0                             ld      (UbnKShipUnivBankNbr),a
 668+ C990 FD 7D                                ld      a,iyl
 669+ C992 32 43 C0                             ld      (UBnKShipModelId),a
 670+ C995 CD 0F E0                             call    GetShipBankId                ; this will mostly be debugging info
 671+ C998 32 41 C0                             ld      (UBnkShipModelBank),a        ; this will mostly be debugging info
 672+ C99B 78                                   ld      a,b                          ; this will mostly be debugging info
 673+ C99C 32 42 C0                             ld      (UBnKShipModelNbr),a         ; this will mostly be debugging info
 674+ C99F 3A 0A C4     .SetUpMissileCount:     ld      a,(LaserAddr)                ; get laser and missile details
 675+ C9A2 E6 0F                                and     ShipMissileCount
 676+ C9A4 4F                                   ld      c,a
 677+ C9A5 3A C3 7D                             ld      a,(RandomSeed1)              ; missile flag limit
 678+ C9A8 A1                                   and     c                            ; .
 679+ C9A9 32 5C C0                             ld      (UBnKMissilesLeft),a
 680+ C9AC 3A 0A C4     .SetupLaserType         ld      a,(LaserAddr)
 681+ C9AF E6 F0                                and     ShipLaserPower
 682+ C9B1 ED 23                                swapnib
 683+ C9B3 32 5B C0                             ld      (UBnKLaserPower),a
 684+ C9B6 3A 0F C4     .SetUpFighterBays:      ld      a,(ShipAIFlagsAddr)
 685+ C9B9 4F                                   ld      c,a
 686+ C9BA E6 70                                and     ShipFighterBaySize
 687+ C9BC                                      JumpIfANENusng ShipFighterBaySizeInf, .LimitedBay
 687+ C9BC FE 70       >                        cp     ShipFighterBaySizeInf
 687+ C9BE C2 C3 C9    >                        jp      nz,.LimitedBay
 688+ C9C1 3E FF                                ld      a,$FF                       ; force unlimited ships
 689+ C9C3 ED 23        .LimitedBay:            swapnib                             ; as its bits 6 to 4 and we have removed bit 7 we can cheat with a swapnib
 690+ C9C5 32 5E C0                             ld      (UBnKFightersLeft),a
 691+ C9C8 79           .SetUpFighterType:      ld      a,c                         ; get back AI flags
 692+ C9C9 E6 0C                                and     ShipFighterType             ; fighter type is bits 2 and 3
 693+ C9CB CB 1F                                rr      a                           ; so get them down to 0 and 1
 694+ C9CD CB 1F                                rr      a                           ;
 695+ C9CF 21 6E C9                             ld      hl,FighterTypeMapping       ; then use the lookup table
 696+ C9D2 ED 31                                add     hl,a                        ; for the respective ship id
 697+ C9D4 7E                                   ld      a,(hl)                      ; we work on this for optimisation
 698+ C9D5 32 5D C0                             ld      (UBnKFighterShipId),a       ; ship data holds index to this table
 699+ C9D8 3A 10 C4     .SetUpECM:              ld      a,(ShipECMFittedChanceAddr) ; Now handle ECM
 700+ C9DB 47                                   ld      b,a
 701+ C9DC 3A C5 7D     .FetchLatestRandom:     ld      a,(RandomSeed3)
 702+ C9DF                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .ECMFitted
 702+ C9DF B8          >                        cp      b
 702+ C9E0 DA EB C9    >                        jp		c, .ECMFitted
 703+ C9E3              .ECMNotFitted:          SetMemFalse UBnKECMFitted
 703+ C9E3 3E FF       >                        ld      a,$FF
 703+ C9E5 32 5A C0    >                        ld      (UBnKECMFitted),a
 704+ C9E8 C3 EF C9                             jp      .DoneECM
 705+ C9EB              .ECMFitted:             SetMemTrue  UBnKECMFitted
 705+ C9EB AF          >                        xor     a
 705+ C9EC 32 5A C0    >                        ld      (UBnKECMFitted),a
 706+ C9EF              .DoneECM:               ; TODO set up laser power
 707+ C9EF C9                                   ret
 708+ C9F0                  DISPLAY "Tracing 2", $

 710+ C9F0                                      include "Universe/Ships/InitialiseOrientation.asm"
# file opened: ./Universe/Ships/InitialiseOrientation.asm
   1++C9F0              ;  sidev = (1,  0,  0)  sidev = (&6000, 0, 0)
   2++C9F0              ;  roofv = (0,  1,  0)  roofv = (0, &6000, 0)
   3++C9F0              ;  nosev = (0,  0, -1)  nosev = (0, 0, &E000)   E000 = SignBit[96]
   4++C9F0              InitialiseOrientation:
   5++C9F0 21 00 00     ZI1:                    ld      hl, 0
   6++C9F3 22 2B C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatSidevY),hl                ; set the zeroes
   7++C9F6 22 2D C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatSidevZ),hl                ; set the zeroes
   8++C9F9 22 2F C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatRoofvX),hl                ; set the zeroes
   9++C9FC 22 33 C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatRoofvZ),hl                ; set the zeroes
  10++C9FF 22 35 C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatNosevX),hl                ; set the zeroes
  11++CA02 22 37 C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatNosevY),hl                ; set the zeroes
  12++CA05              ; Optimised as already have 0 in l
  13++CA05 26 60                                ld      h, $60	             				; 96 in hi byte
  14++CA07                                      ;ld      hl,1
  15++CA07 22 29 C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatSidevX),hl
  16++CA0A 22 31 C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatRoofvY),hl
  17++CA0D              ; Optimised as already have 0 in l
  18++CA0D 26 E0                                ld      h, $E0					            ; -96 in hi byte which is +96 with hl bit 7 set
  19++CA0F 22 39 C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatNosevZ),hl
  20++CA12 C9                                   ret
  21++CA13
  22++CA13              InitialisePlayerMissileOrientation:
  23++CA13 CD F0 C9                             call    InitialiseOrientation
  24++CA16 21 00 60                             ld      hl,$6000
  25++CA19 22 39 C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatNosevZ),hl           ; mius
  26++CA1C C9                                   ret
  27++CA1D
  28++CA1D

  32++CA1D CD F0 C9     LaunchedOrientation:    call    InitialiseOrientation

  33++CA20 3A 36 C0    >                        ld  a,(UBnkrotmatNosevX+1)

  34++CA2B EE 80       >                        xor SignOnly8Bit

  35++CA30 3A 3A C0    >                        ld  a,(UBnkrotmatNosevZ+1)

 711+ CA39
 712+ CA39              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 713+ CA39              ;OrientateVertex:
 714+ CA39              ;                      [ sidev_x sidev_y sidev_z ]   [ x ]
 715+ CA39              ;  projected [x y z] = [ roofv_x roofv_y roofv_z ] . [ y ]
 716+ CA39              ;                      [ nosev_x nosev_y nosev_z ]   [ z ]
 717+ CA39              ;
 718+ CA39
 719+ CA39              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 720+ CA39              ;TransposeVertex:
 721+ CA39              ;                      [ sidev_x roofv_x nosev_x ]   [ x ]
 722+ CA39              ;  projected [x y z] = [ sidev_y roofv_y nosev_y ] . [ y ]
 723+ CA39              ;                      [ sidev_z roofv_z nosev_z ]   [ z ]
 724+ CA39              ; VectorToVertex:
 725+ CA39              ;                     [ sidev_x roofv_x nosev_x ]   [ x ]   [ x ]
 726+ CA39              ;  vector to vertex = [ sidev_y roofv_y nosev_y ] . [ y ] + [ y ]
 727+ CA39              ;                     [ sidev_z roofv_z nosev_z ]   [ z ]   [ z ]
 728+ CA39              ;INPUTS:    bhl = dividend  cde = divisor where b and c are sign bytes
 729+ CA39              ;OUTPUTS:   cahl = quotient cde = divisor
 730+ CA39              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 731+ CA39                                      ;include "./ModelRender/EraseOldLines-EE51.asm"
 732+ CA39               ; OBSOLETE                       include "./ModelRender/TrimToScreenGrad-LL118.asm"
 733+ CA39                                      include "./ModelRender/CLIP-LL145.asm"
# file opened: ././ModelRender/CLIP-LL145.asm
   1++CA39              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
   2++CA39
   3++CA39 00           clipDx                  DB      0           ; also XX12+2
   4++CA3A 00           clipDxHigh              DB      0           ; also XX12+3
   5++CA3B 00           clipDxHighNonABS        DB      0           ; also XX12+3
   6++CA3C 00           clipDy                  DB      0           ; also XX12+4
   7++CA3D 00           clipDyHigh              DB      0           ; also XX12+5
   8++CA3E 00           clipGradient            DB      0
   9++CA3F 00           clipDxySign             DB      0
  10++CA40              varX12p3                equ     clipDxySign
  11++CA40 00           clipXGTY                DB      0
  12++CA41 00           clipFlags               DB      0
  13++CA42 00           SWAP                    DB      0
  14++CA43 00 00        varYX                   DW      0
  15++CA45              ;varRegX                 DB      0
  16++CA45              ;varXX12p2               DB      0
  17++CA45 00           clipXX13                 DB      0
  18++CA46 00           Gradient                DB      0
  19++CA47              ; for start and end y. bit7 of lower determines its not been setup yet
  20++CA47
  21++CA47              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  22++CA47                      IFNDEF       CLIPVersion3
  23++CA47 ED 4B A8 C0  ClipLine:               ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)          ; bc - XX15(2,3) Y1
  24++CA4B DD 2A AC C0                          ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY2)          ; ix - XX12(0,1) Y2
  25++CA4F 2A A6 C0                             ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)          ; hl - XX15(0,1) X1
  26++CA52 ED 5B AA C0                          ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)          ; de - XX15(4,5) X2
  27++CA56 AF                                   xor     a
  28++CA57 32 42 CA                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; SWAP = 0
  29++CA5A 7A                                   ld      a,d                         ; A = X2Hi
  30++CA5B FD 26 BF     .LL147:                 ld      iyh,$BF                     ; we need to be 191 as its 128 + another bit set from 0 to 6, we are using iyh as regX (128 will actually do)
  31++CA5E DD B4                                or      ixh                         ; if (X2Hi L-OR Y2 Hi <> 0) goto LL107             -- X2Y2 off screen
  32++CA60 20 0A                                jr      nz, .LL107
  33++CA62 DD 7D                                ld      a,ixl
  34++CA64 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; if screen hight < y2 lo, i.e y2 lo >127 goto LL107,
  35++CA67 20 03                                jr      nz,.LL107
  36++CA69 FD 26 00                             ld      iyh, 0                      ; else iyh = regX = 0                                                                        -- X2Y2 on screen
  37++CA6C              ; XX13 = regX (i.e. iyh)      ( if XX13 = XX13 is 191 if (x2, y2) is off-screen else 0) we bin XX13 as not needed
  38++CA6C              ; so XX13 = 0 if x2_hi = y2_hi = 0, y2_lo is on-screen,  XX13 = 191 if x2_hi or y2_hi are non-zero or y2_lo is off the bottom of the screen
  39++CA6C FD 7C        .LL107                  ld      a,iyh
  40++CA6E 32 45 CA                             ld      (clipXX13),a                ; debug copy iyh to xx13
  41++CA71 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If (X1 hi L-OR Y1) hi  goto LL83                   -- X1Y1 off screen and maybe X2Y2
  42++CA72 B0                                   or      b                           ;
  43++CA73 20 27                                jr      nz,.LL83                    ;
  44++CA75 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; or (y1 lo > bottom of screen)
  45++CA76 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; i.e  screen height < y1)
  46++CA79 20 21                                jr      nz,.LL83
  47++CA7B              ; If we get here, (x1, y1) is on-screen
  48++CA7B FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh = xx13 at this point if  XX13 <> 0 goto LL108                                                        -- X1Y1 on screen, if we flagged X2Y2 off screen goto LL108
  49++CA7D FE 00                                cp      0
  50++CA7F 20 15                                jr      nz, .LL108
  51++CA81              ; Finished clipping exit point ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  52++CA81 79           .ClipDone:              ld      a,c                         ; LL146 (Clip Done)               Y1 = y1 lo, x2 = x2 lo, x1 = x1 lo y1 = y1 lo                                   -- Nothing off screen
  53++CA82 32 A7 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY1),a
  54++CA85 DD 7D                                ld      a,ixl
  55++CA87 32 A9 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY2),a
  56++CA8A 7D                                   ld      a,l
  57++CA8B 32 A6 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX1),a
  58++CA8E 7B                                   ld      a,e
  59++CA8F 32 A8 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX2),a
  60++CA92                                      ClearCarryFlag                      ; carry is clear so valid to plot is in XX15(0to3)
  60++CA92 B7          >                        or a
  61++CA93 C9                                   ret                                 ; 2nd pro different, it swops based on swop flag around here.
  62++CA94              ; Finished out of bounds exit point -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  63++CA94              .PointsOutofBounds:     SetCarryFlag                        ; LL109 (ClipFailed) carry flag set as not visible
  63++CA94 37          >                        scf
  64++CA95 C9                                   ret
  65++CA96 FD 7C        .LL108:                 ld      a,iyh
  66++CA98 B7                                   or      a
  67++CA99 1F                                   rra
  68++CA9A FD 67                                ld      iyh,a                       ; (X2Y2 Off Screen)         XX13 = 95 (i.e. divide it by 2)                                                 -- X1Y1 on screen X2Y2 off screen
  69++CA9C FD 7C        .LL83:                  ld      a,iyh                       ; (Line On screen Test)      if XX13 < 128 then only 1 point is on screen so goto LL115                      -- We only need to deal with X2Y2
  70++CA9E ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
  71++CAA1 28 28                                jr      z, .LL115                   ;
  72++CAA3              ;                       Check for X1 and X2 negative
  73++CAA3 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If both x1_hi and x2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  74++CAA4 A2                                   and     d
  75++CAA5                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  75++CAA5 FA 94 CA    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  76++CAA8              ;                       Check for Y1 and Y2 negative
  77++CAA8 78                                   ld      a,b                         ; If both y1_hi and y2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  78++CAA9 DD A4                                and     ixh
  79++CAAB                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  79++CAAB FA 94 CA    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  80++CAAE              ;                       Check for X1 and X2 both > 255
  81++CAAE 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If neither (x1_hi - 1) or (x2_hi - 1) have bit 7 set, jump to LL109 to return from the subroutine with the C  flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
  82++CAAF 3D                                   dec     a
  83++CAB0 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a                       ; using iyl as XX12+2 var
  84++CAB2 7A                                   ld      a,d                         ; a = x2 hi
  85++CAB3 3D                                   dec     a
  86++CAB4 FD B5                                or      iyl                         ; (x2 hi -1 ) or (x1 hi -1)
  87++CAB6                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
  87++CAB6 F2 94 CA    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
  88++CAB9              ; by here we have eliminated -ve Y1 bounds so can just test for positive high and bit 7 of lo
  89++CAB9 DD 7C                                ld      a,ixh
  90++CABB 3D                                   dec     a
  91++CABC FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
  92++CABE 78                                   ld      a,b
  93++CABF 3D                                   dec     a
  94++CAC0 FD B5                                or      iyl
  95++CAC2                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
  95++CAC2 F2 94 CA    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
  96++CAC5 79                                   ld      a,c
  97++CAC6 DD A5                                and     ixl
  98++CAC8                                      JumpIfNegative .PointsOutofBounds   ; really if both are > 127
  98++CAC8 FA 94 CA    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  99++CACB              ; Clip line: calulate the line's gradient
 100++CACB              ; here as an optimisation we make sure X1 is always < X2  later on
 101++CACB              .LL115:                 ClearCarryFlag
 101++CACB B7          >                        or a
 102++CACC E5 D5        .CalcDX:                push    hl,,de
 103++CACE EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; so hl is x2 and de = x1
 104++CACF ED 52                                sbc     hl,de
 105++CAD1 22 39 CA                             ld      (clipDx),hl
 106++CAD4 7C                                   ld      a,h
 107++CAD5 32 3B CA                             ld      (clipDxHighNonABS),a
 108++CAD8              .CalcDy:                ClearCarryFlag
 108++CAD8 B7          >                        or a
 109++CAD9 DD E5 E1                             ld      hl,ix
 110++CADC ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc
 111++CADE 54 5D                                ld      de,hl           ;;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21
 112++CAE0 22 3C CA                             ld      (clipDy),hl     ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 113++CAE3 7C           .CalcQuadrant:          ld      a,h
 114++CAE4 32 3D CA                             ld      (clipDyHigh),a              ; so A = sign of deltay in effect
 115++CAE7              ; So we now have delta_x in XX12(3 2), delta_y in XX12(5 4)  where the delta is (x1, y1) - (x2, y2))
 116++CAE7 21 3A CA                             ld      hl,clipDxHigh
 117++CAEA AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; now a = sign dx xor sign dy
 118++CAEB 32 CF 7E                             ld      (varS),a                    ; DEBGU putting it in var S too for now
 119++CAEE 32 3F CA                             ld      (clipDxySign),a
 120++CAF1 3A 3D CA     .AbsDy:                 ld      a,(clipDyHigh)
 121++CAF4 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 122++CAF7 28 0E                                jr      z,.LL110                    ; If delta_y_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 123++CAF9 ED 5B 3C CA                          ld      de,(clipDy)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 124++CAFD                                      macronegate16de                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 124++CAFD AF          >					xor 	a
 124++CAFE 93          >                    sub 	e
 124++CAFF 5F          >                    ld 		e,a
 124++CB00 9F          >                    sbc 	a,a
 124++CB01 92          >                    sub 	d
 124++CB02 57          >                    ld 		d,a
 125++CB03 ED 53 3C CA                          ld      (clipDy),de                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 126++CB07 2A 39 CA     .LL110:                 ld      hl,(clipDx)
 127++CB0A 3A 3A CA                             ld      a,(clipDxHigh)
 128++CB0D ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; is it a negative X
 129++CB10 28 06                                jr      z,.LL111                    ; If delta_x_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 130++CB12                                      ;ld      hl,(clipDx)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 131++CB12                                      macronegate16hl                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 131++CB12 AF          >					xor 	a
 131++CB13 95          >					sub 	l
 131++CB14 6F          >					ld 		l,a
 131++CB15 9F          >					sbc 	a,a
 131++CB16 94          >					sub 	h
 131++CB17 67          >					ld 		h,a
 132++CB18              .LL111:
 133++CB18 7C           .ScaleLoop:             ld      a,h                         ; At this point DX and DY are ABS values
 134++CB19 B2                                   or      d
 135++CB1A 28 0A                                jr      z,.CalculateDelta
 136++CB1C                                      ShiftDERight1
 136++CB1C CB 3A       >			   srl d
 136++CB1E CB 1B       >			   rr  e
 137++CB20                                      ShiftHLRight1
 137++CB20 CB 3C       >			   srl h
 137++CB22 CB 1D       >			   rr  l
 138++CB24 18 F2                                jr      .ScaleLoop                  ; scaled down Dx and Dy to 8 bit, Dy may have been negative
 139++CB26              .CalculateDelta:
 140++CB26              ; By now, the high bytes of both |delta_x| and |delta_y| are zero We know that h and d are both = 0 as that's what we tested with a BEQ
 141++CB26 AF           .LL113:                 xor     a
 142++CB27 32 E9 7E                             ld      (varT),a                    ; t = 0
 143++CB2A 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; If delta_x_lo < delta_y_lo, so our line is more vertical than horizontal, jump to LL114
 144++CB2B                                      JumpIfALTNusng  e, .LL114           ;
 144++CB2B BB          >                        cp      e
 144++CB2C DA 3C CB    >                        jp		c, .LL114
 145++CB2F              ; Here Dx >= Dy sp calculate Delta Y / delta X
 146++CB2F 32 CD 7E     .DxGTEDy:               ld      (varQ),a                    ; Set Q = delta_x_lo
 147++CB32 57                                   ld      d,a                         ; d = also Q for calc
 148++CB33 7B                                   ld      a,e                         ; Set A = delta_y_lo
 149++CB34 CD 4B 94                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate:  R (actually a reg) = 256 * A / Q   = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo
 150++CB37 32 CE 7E                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 151++CB3A 18 10                                jr      .LL116                      ; Jump to LL116, as we now have the line's gradient in R
 152++CB3C              ; Here Delta Y > Delta X so calulate delta X / delta Y
 153++CB3C 7B           .LL114:                 ld      a,e                         ; Set Q = delta_y_lo
 154++CB3D 57                                   ld      d,a
 155++CB3E 32 CD 7E                             ld      (varQ),a
 156++CB41 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; Set A = delta_x_lo
 157++CB42 CD 4B 94                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q  = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 158++CB45 32 CE 7E                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 159++CB48 21 E9 7E                             ld      hl,varT                     ; T was set to 0 above, so this sets T = &FF
 160++CB4B 35                                   dec     (hl)
 161++CB4C D1           .LL116:                 pop     de                          ; get back X2
 162++CB4D E1                                   pop     hl                          ; get back X1 into hl,
 163++CB4E 3A CE 7E                             ld      a,(varR)                    ; Store the gradient in XX12+2 this can be optimised later
 164++CB51 32 3E CA                             ld      (clipGradient),a
 165++CB54 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
 166++CB56 3A CF 7E                             ld      a,(varS)
 167++CB59 32 3F CA                             ld      (clipDxySign),a             ;  Store the type of slope in XX12+3, bit 7 clear means ?Not needed as clipDxySign is used for varS earlier?
 168++CB5C                                                                          ; top left to bottom right, bit 7 set means top right to bottom left **CODE IS WRONG HERE A TEST IS BL to TR
 169++CB5C FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh was XX13 from earlier
 170++CB5E FE 00                                cp      0                           ; If XX13 = 0, skip the following instruction
 171++CB60 28 05                                jr      z,.LL138                    ;
 172++CB62 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If XX13 is positive, it must be 95. This means (x1, y1) is on-screen but (x2, y2) isn't, so we jump to LLX117 to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)
 173++CB65 28 13                                jr      z,.LLX117                   ; coordinates around before doing the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 174++CB67              ; If we get here, XX13 = 0 or 191, so (x1, y1) is off-screen and needs clipping
 175++CB67 CD 8E CB     .LL138                  call    ClipPointHLBC               ; Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 176++CB6A FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; If XX13 = 0, i.e. (x2, y2) is on-screen, jump down to LL124 to return with a successfully clipped line
 177++CB6C ED 27 80                             test    $80
 178++CB6F 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL124
 179++CB71              ; If we get here, XX13 = 191 (both coordinates are off-screen)
 180++CB71 7C           .LL117:                 ld      a,h                         ; If either of x1_hi or y1_hi are non-zero, jump to
 181++CB72 B0                                   or      b                           ; LL137 to return from the subroutine with the C flag
 182++CB73 C2 94 CA                             jp      nz, .PointsOutofBounds      ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 183++CB76 B1                                   or      c                           ; if x1 and y1 hi are both zero test bit 8 or Y1 to see if its > 128
 184++CB77 FA 94 CA                             jp      m, .PointsOutofBounds       ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 185++CB7A              ; If we get here, XX13 = 95 or 191, and in both cases (x2, y2) is off-screen, so we now need to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) coordinates around before doing
 186++CB7A              ; the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 187++CB7A EB           .LLX117:                ex      de,hl                       ;  swap X1 and X2
 188++CB7B DD E5                                push    ix                          ;  swap Y1 and Y2
 189++CB7D C5                                   push    bc
 190++CB7E DD E1                                pop     ix
 191++CB80 C1                                   pop     bc
 192++CB81 CD 8E CB                             call    ClipPointHLBC               ;  Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 193++CB84 3A 42 CA                             ld      a,(SWAP)
 194++CB87 3D                                   dec     a
 195++CB88 32 42 CA                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; Set SWAP = &FF to indicate that we just clipped the line at the (x2, y2) end by swapping the coordinates (the DEC does this as we set SWAP to 0 at the start of this subroutine)
 196++CB8B C3 81 CA     .LL124:                 jp      .ClipDone                    ; now put points in place
 197++CB8E              ; Move a point along a line until it is on-screen point is held in HL(X) BC(Y) LL118
 198++CB8E              ; iyh still holds XX13 iyl still holds gradient
 199++CB8E 7C           ClipPointHLBC:          ld      a,h                         ; If x1_hi is positive, jump down to LL119 to skip the following
 200++CB8F ED 27 80                             test    $80
 201++CB92 28 17                                jr      z,.LL119
 202++CB94 32 CF 7E     .X1isNegative:          ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is negative, i.e. off the left of the screen, so set S = x1_hi
 203++CB97 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 204++CB9A CD 10 CC                             call    LL120                       ;  Call LL120 to calculate:   (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0   = x1 * gradient
 205++CB9D                                                                          ;                             (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0  = x1 / gradient
 206++CB9D                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 207++CB9D C1 D1 E1                             pop    hl,,de,,bc                   ;  get coordinates back
 208++CBA0 2A 43 CA                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 209++CBA3 09                                   add     hl,bc                       ; y1 = y1 + varYX
 210++CBA4 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl
 211++CBA6 21 00 00                             ld      hl,0                        ; Set x1 = 0
 212++CBA9 18 1A                                jr      .LL134                      ; in BBC is set x to 0 to force jump, we will just jump
 213++CBAB FE 00        .LL119:                 cp      0
 214++CBAD 28 16                                jr      z,.LL134                    ;  If x1_hi = 0 then jump down to LL134 to skip the following, as the x-coordinate is already on-screen (as 0 <= (x_hi x_lo) <= 255)
 215++CBAF 3D                                   dec     a
 216++CBB0 32 CF 7E                             ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is positive, i.e. x1 >= 256 and off the right side of the screen, so set S = x1_hi - 1
 217++CBB3 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 218++CBB6 CD 10 CC                             call    LL120                      ;  Call LL120 to calculate: (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0  = (x1 - 256) * gradient
 219++CBB9                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0 = (x1 - 256) / gradient
 220++CBB9                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of theline's direction of slope
 221++CBB9 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 222++CBBC 2A 43 CA                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 223++CBBF 09                                   add     hl,bc                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 224++CBC0 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 225++CBC2 21 FF 00                             ld      hl,255                      ; Set x1 = 255
 226++CBC5              ; We have moved the point so the x-coordinate is on screen (i.e. in the range 0-255), so now for they-coordinate
 227++CBC5 78           .LL134:                 ld      a,b                         ; If y1_hi is positive, jump down to LL135  to skip the following
 228++CBC6 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
 229++CBC9 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL135                    ;
 230++CBCB 32 CF 7E                             ld      (varS),a                    ; Otherwise y1_hi is negative, i.e. off the top of the screen, so set S = y1_hi
 231++CBCE 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; Set R = y1_lo
 232++CBCF 32 CE 7E                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 233++CBD2 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 234++CBD5 CD 71 CC                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 235++CBD8                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 236++CBD8                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 237++CBD8 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 238++CBDB D5                                   push    de
 239++CBDC EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; de = x1
 240++CBDD 2A 43 CA                             ld      hl,(varYX)                  ; hl = varYX
 241++CBE0 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 242++CBE1 D1                                   pop     de                          ; de = x2 again
 243++CBE2 01 00 00                             ld      bc,0                        ; Set y1 = 0
 244++CBE5 79           .LL135:                 ld      a,c                         ; if bc < 128 then no work to do
 245++CBE6 E6 80                                and     $80
 246++CBE8 B0                                   or      b                           ; here we see if c bit 8 is set or anything in b as we know if its 0 this would mean there is no need to clip
 247++CBE9 C8                                   ret     z
 248++CBEA E5                                   push    hl
 249++CBEB 60 69                                ld      hl,bc
 250++CBED 01 80 00                             ld      bc,128
 251++CBF0 B7                                   or      a
 252++CBF1 ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc                       ; hl =  (S R) = (y1_hi y1_lo) - 128
 253++CBF3 22 CE 7E                             ld      (varRS), hl                 ; and now RS (or SR)
 254++CBF6 7C                                   ld      a,h
 255++CBF7 E1                                   pop     hl
 256++CBF8 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If the subtraction underflowed, i.e. if y1 < 192, then y1 is already on-screen, so jump to LL136 to return from the subroutine, as we are done
 257++CBFB C0                                   ret     nz
 258++CBFC              ; If we get here then y1 >= 192, i.e. off the bottom of the screen
 259++CBFC E5 D5 C5     .LL139:                 push    hl,,de,,bc
 260++CBFF CD 71 CC                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 261++CC02                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 262++CC02                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 263++CC02 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 264++CC05 D5                                   push    de
 265++CC06 EB                                   ex      hl,de
 266++CC07 2A 43 CA                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 267++CC0A 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 268++CC0B 01 7F 00                             ld      bc,127                      ; set bc to 127 bottom of screen
 269++CC0E D1                                   pop     de
 270++CC0F C9           .LL136:                 ret                                 ;  Return from the subroutine
 271++CC10                      ENDIF
 272++CC10
 273++CC10              ; Calculate the following:   * If T = 0  (more vertical than horizontal), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2
 274++CC10              ;                            * If T <> 0 (more horizontal than vertical), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2
 275++CC10              ;                              giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 276++CC10              ; Other entry points        LL122                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) * Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 277++CC10 7D           LL120:                  ld      a,l                          ; Set R = x1_lo
 278++CC11 32 CE 7E                             ld      (varR),a
 279++CC14 CD CE CC                             call    LL129                        ;  Call LL129 to do the following:  Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 280++CC17 F5                                   push    af                           ;  Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 281++CC18 C5                                   push    bc
 282++CC19 47                                   ld      b,a
 283++CC1A 3A E9 7E                             ld      a,(varT)                     ; instead : (Y X) = (S R ) / Q
 284++CC1D FE 00                                cp      0
 285++CC1F 78                                   ld      a,b
 286++CC20 C1                                   pop     bc                           ; we can't use af as that would disrupt the flags
 287++CC21 C2 38 CC                             jp      nz, .LL121
 288++CC24              ; The following calculates:  (Y X) = (S R) * Q using the same shift-and-add algorithm that's documented in MULT1
 289++CC24 3A 3E CA     .LL122:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 290++CC27 32 CD 7E                             ld      (varQ),a; optimise
 291++CC2A CD D7 8F                             call    HLequSRmulQdiv256
 292++CC2D 22 43 CA                             ld      (varYX),hl
 293++CC30 F1                                   pop     af
 294++CC31 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 295++CC34 CA 64 CC                             jp      z,.LL133
 296++CC37 C9                                   ret
 297++CC38 11 FE FF     .LL121:                  ld      de,$FFFE                    ; set XY to &FFFE at start, de holds XY
 298++CC3B 2A CE 7E                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; hl = RS
 299++CC3E 3A CD 7E                             ld      a,(varQ)
 300++CC41 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = q
 301++CC42              .LL130:                 ShiftHLLeft1                        ; RS *= 2
 301++CC42 CB 25       >			   sla l
 301++CC44 CB 14       >			   rl  h
 302++CC46 7C                                   ld      a,h
 303++CC47 38 04                                jr      c,.LL131                    ; if S overflowed skip Q test and do subtractions
 304++CC49                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .LL132            ; if S <  Q = 256/gradient skip subtractions
 304++CC49 B8          >                        cp      b
 304++CC4A DA 55 CC    >                        jp		c, .LL132
 305++CC4D 3F           .LL131:                 ccf                                 ; compliment carry
 306++CC4E 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; q
 307++CC4F 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; h (s)
 308++CC50 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; r
 309++CC51 DE 00                                sbc     a,0                         ; 0 - so in effect SR - Q*256
 310++CC53 37                                   scf                                 ; set carry for next rolls
 311++CC54 3F                                   ccf
 312++CC55              .LL132:                 RollDELeft1                         ; Rotate de bits left
 312++CC55 CB 13       >               rl  e
 312++CC57 CB 12       >               rl  d
 313++CC59 38 E7                                jr      c,.LL130                    ;
 314++CC5B ED 53 43 CA                          ld      (varYX),de
 315++CC5F F1                                   pop     af              ; get back sign
 316++CC60 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 317++CC63 C8                                   ret     z               ; if negative then return with value as is reversed sign
 318++CC64 2A 43 CA     .LL133:                 ld      hl,(varYX)      ; may not actually need this?
 319++CC67                                      NegHL
 319++CC67 AF          >                    xor a
 319++CC68 95          >                    sub l
 319++CC69 6F          >                    ld l,a
 319++CC6A 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 319++CC6B 94          >                    sub h
 319++CC6C 67          >                    ld h,a
 320++CC6D 22 43 CA                             ld      (varYX),hl
 321++CC70 C9           .LL128:                 ret
 322++CC71
 323++CC71
 324++CC71
 325++CC71
 326++CC71              ; Calculate the following: * If T = 0,  calculate (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2 (actually SR & XX12+2 /256)
 327++CC71              ;                          * If T <> 0, calculate (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2
 328++CC71              ;                          giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 329++CC71              ;
 330++CC71              ; Other entry points:      LL121                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) / Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 331++CC71              ;                          LL133                Negate (Y X) and return from the subroutine
 332++CC71              ;                          LL128                Contains an RTS
 333++CC71 CD CE CC     LL123:                  call    LL129                       ; Call LL129 to do the following: Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 334++CC74 F5                                   push    af                          ; Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 335++CC75 C5                                   push    bc                          ; If T is non-zero, so it's more horizontal than vertical, jump down to LL121 to calculate this
 336++CC76 47                                   ld      b,a
 337++CC77 3A E9 7E                             ld      a,(varT)                    ; instead : (Y X) = (S R) * Q *** this looks to be the wrong way roudn for Y!!!!
 338++CC7A FE 00                                cp      0
 339++CC7C 78                                   ld      a,b
 340++CC7D C1                                   pop     bc
 341++CC7E C2 BA CC                             jp      nz, .LL122
 342++CC81              ; The following calculates: (Y X) = (S R) / Q using the same shift-and-subtract algorithm that's documented in TIS2, its actually X.Y=R.S*256/Q
 343++CC81 11 FE FF     .LL121:                 ld      de,$FFFE                    ; set XY to &FFFE at start, de holds XY
 344++CC84 2A CE 7E                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; hl = RS
 345++CC87 3A CD 7E                             ld      a,(varQ)
 346++CC8A 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = q
 347++CC8B              .LL130:                 ShiftHLLeft1                        ; RS *= 2
 347++CC8B CB 25       >			   sla l
 347++CC8D CB 14       >			   rl  h
 348++CC8F 7C                                   ld      a,h
 349++CC90 38 04                                jr      c,.LL131                    ; if S overflowed skip Q test and do subtractions
 350++CC92                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .LL132            ; if S <  Q = 256/gradient skip subtractions
 350++CC92 B8          >                        cp      b
 350++CC93 DA 9E CC    >                        jp		c, .LL132
 351++CC96 3F           .LL131:                 ccf                                 ; compliment carry
 352++CC97 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; q
 353++CC98 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; h (s)
 354++CC99 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; r
 355++CC9A DE 00                                sbc     a,0                         ; 0 - so in effect SR - Q*256
 356++CC9C 37                                   scf                                 ; set carry for next rolls
 357++CC9D 3F                                   ccf
 358++CC9E              .LL132:                 RollDELeft1                         ; Rotate de bits left
 358++CC9E CB 13       >               rl  e
 358++CCA0 CB 12       >               rl  d
 359++CCA2 38 E7                                jr      c,.LL130                    ;
 360++CCA4 ED 53 43 CA                          ld      (varYX),de
 361++CCA8 F1                                   pop     af              ; get back sign
 362++CCA9 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 363++CCAC C8                                   ret     z               ; if negative then return with value as is reversed sign
 364++CCAD 2A 43 CA     .LL133:                 ld      hl,(varYX)      ; may not actually need this?
 365++CCB0                                      NegHL
 365++CCB0 AF          >                    xor a
 365++CCB1 95          >                    sub l
 365++CCB2 6F          >                    ld l,a
 365++CCB3 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 365++CCB4 94          >                    sub h
 365++CCB5 67          >                    ld h,a
 366++CCB6 22 43 CA                             ld      (varYX),hl
 367++CCB9 C9           .LL128:                 ret
 368++CCBA              ; The following calculates:  (Y X) = (S R) * Q using the same shift-and-add algorithm that's documented in MULT1
 369++CCBA 3A 3E CA     .LL122:                 ld      a,(clipGradient)
 370++CCBD 32 CD 7E                             ld      (varQ),a; optimise
 371++CCC0 CD D7 8F                             call    HLequSRmulQdiv256
 372++CCC3 22 43 CA                             ld      (varYX),hl
 373++CCC6 F1                                   pop     af
 374++CCC7 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 375++CCCA CA AD CC                             jp      z,.LL133
 376++CCCD C9                                   ret
 377++CCCE
 378++CCCE              ; Do the following, in this order:  Q = XX12+2
 379++CCCE              ;                                   A = S EOR XX12+3
 380++CCCE              ;                                   (S R) = |S R|
 381++CCCE              ; This sets up the variables required above to calculate (S R) / XX12+2 and give the result the opposite sign to XX13+3.
 382++CCCE 3A 3E CA     LL129:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 383++CCD1 32 CD 7E                             ld      (varQ),a                    ; Set Q = XX12+2
 384++CCD4 3A CF 7E                             ld      a,(varS)                    ; If S is positive, jump to LL127
 385++CCD7 E5 F5                                push    hl,,af                      ; else
 386++CCD9 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;   if bit 7 is clear
 387++CCDC 28 0C                                jr      z,.LL127                    ;      RS = ABS RS
 388++CCDE 2A CE 7E                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ;      .
 389++CCE1                                      NegHL                               ;      .
 389++CCE1 AF          >                    xor a
 389++CCE2 95          >                    sub l
 389++CCE3 6F          >                    ld l,a
 389++CCE4 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 389++CCE5 94          >                    sub h
 389++CCE6 67          >                    ld h,a
 390++CCE7 22 CE 7E                             ld      (varRS),hl                  ;      .
 391++CCEA 21 3F CA     .LL127:                 ld      hl,clipDxySign              ;   hl = dxy sign
 392++CCED F1                                   pop     af                          ;
 393++CCEE AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; a = S XOR clipDxySign
 394++CCEF E1                                   pop     hl
 395++CCF0 C9                                   ret
 396++CCF1
 397++CCF1              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 398++CCF1              ; Thow away out of bounds by more than 250
 399++CCF1              ClipLineV3:             ;break
 400++CCF1                      IFDEF       CLIPVersion3
 401++CCF1 ~            ;My logic version
 402++CCF1 ~            .CheckYorder:
 403++CCF1 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipY1)
 404++CCF1 ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipY2)
 405++CCF1 ~                                    call    CompareHLDESgn
 406++CCF1 ~                                    jr      c,.LineP1toP2                          ; if Y1 < Y2 then we can use the points as is else we have to swap
 407++CCF1 ~            .LineP2toP1:            ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY2)                      ; fetch and write out in reverse
 408++CCF1 ~                                    ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY1)
 409++CCF1 ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX1)
 410++CCF1 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX2)
 411++CCF1 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipY1),bc                      ; bc - XX15(2,3) Y1
 412++CCF1 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipY2),ix                      ; ix - XX12(0,1) Y2
 413++CCF1 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipX1),hl                      ; hl - XX15(0,1) X1
 414++CCF1 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipX2),de                      ;  de - XX15(4,5) X2
 415++CCF1 ~                                    jp      .CheckNoClip
 416++CCF1 ~            .LineP1toP2             ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)                      ; bc - XX15(2,3) Y1
 417++CCF1 ~                                    ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY2)                      ; ix - XX12(0,1) Y2
 418++CCF1 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)                      ; hl - XX15(0,1) X1
 419++CCF1 ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)                      ; de - XX15(4,5) X2
 420++CCF1 ~            .CheckNoClip:           ld      a,b
 421++CCF1 ~                                    or      d
 422++CCF1 ~                                    or      h
 423++CCF1 ~                                    or      ixh
 424++CCF1 ~                                    jp      nz,.CheckXOffScreen                 ; if both Y1 and y2 have bit 7 set
 425++CCF1 ~                                    ld      a,c                                 ; then we clip
 426++CCF1 ~                                    and     ixl
 427++CCF1 ~                                    test    $80
 428++CCF1 ~                                    jp      z, .ClipComplete
 429++CCF1 ~            ;if either x1hi x2hi are 0 then we clip. if both <> 0and both same sign exit
 430++CCF1 ~            .CheckXOffScreen:       ld      a,h
 431++CCF1 ~                                    xor     d
 432++CCF1 ~                                    test    $80                                 ; non descructive test of bit 7 is set
 433++CCF1 ~                                    jp      nz,.X1X2OppositeSign                ; if bit 7 was set then x1 and x2 must be opposite signs so its on screen
 434++CCF1 ~            .X1X2SameSigns:         ld      a,h                                 ; so to get there h and d must be the same sign
 435++CCF1 ~                                    test    $80                                 ; if they are the same sign and at x1 is negative then x2 must be negative so off screen
 436++CCF1 ~                                    JumpIfAIsZero .X1X2CheckIfBothRight
 437++CCF1 ~            .X1X2BothNegative:      SetCarryFlag                                ; to get to here x1 and x2 must be high and off the same sign so its not to draw
 438++CCF1 ~                                    ret
 439++CCF1 ~            .X1X2CheckIfBothRight:  and     a                                   ; we have h in a already
 440++CCF1 ~                                    jr      z,.X1OnScreen
 441++CCF1 ~                                    ld      a,d
 442++CCF1 ~                                    and     a
 443++CCF1 ~                                    jr      z,.X2OnScreen
 444++CCF1 ~            .X1X2OffRightSide:      SetCarryFlag                                ; to get to here x1 and x2 must be high and off the same sign so its not to draw
 445++CCF1 ~                                    ret
 446++CCF1 ~            ;                       to get to here x1 and x2 either span -ve to +ve or from on screen to off screen
 447++CCF1 ~            .X1OnScreen:
 448++CCF1 ~            .X2OnScreen:
 449++CCF1 ~            .X1X2OppositeSign:
 450++CCF1 ~            ;                       Now check to see if Y is off screen
 451++CCF1 ~            .CheckYOffScreen:       ld      a,b                                     ; Check if y1 and y2 are opposite signs, fi so it spans screen so we are good
 452++CCF1 ~            .CheckBothYNegative:    xor     ixh
 453++CCF1 ~                                    test    $80                                     ; if bit 7 is set then opposite signs
 454++CCF1 ~                                    jp      nz,.Y1Y2OppositeSign                    ; if y1 and y2 are opposite signs its on screen and spans at least one side
 455++CCF1 ~            .Y1Y2SameSign:          ld      a,b                                     ; if they are the same sign then if one is negative, so is the other so off screen
 456++CCF1 ~                                    test    $80
 457++CCF1 ~                                    jp      z,.Y1Y2Positive
 458++CCF1 ~            .Y1Y2Negative:          SetCarryFlag
 459++CCF1 ~                                    ret
 460++CCF1 ~            .Y1Y2Positive:          ld      a,c                                     ; if its the same sign y1 or y2 could be 0 and if they are
 461++CCF1 ~                                    and     $80                                     ; this will test to see if b >0 or c > 127
 462++CCF1 ~                                    or      b                                       ;
 463++CCF1 ~                                    jp      z,.Y1OnScreen
 464++CCF1 ~                                    ld      a,ixl
 465++CCF1 ~                                    and     $80
 466++CCF1 ~                                    or      ixh
 467++CCF1 ~                                    jp      z,.Y2OnScreen
 468++CCF1 ~            .Y1Y2OffBottomSide:     SetCarryFlag
 469++CCF1 ~                                    ret
 470++CCF1 ~            .Y1OnScreen:
 471++CCF1 ~            .Y2OnScreen:
 472++CCF1 ~            .Y1Y2OppositeSign:
 473++CCF1 ~            .StartProcessing:       ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)                      ; Now we can test and Clip
 474++CCF1 ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)                      ; de - XX15(4,5)
 475++CCF1 ~                                    ld      iyh,0                                   ; set iyh flags to 0
 476++CCF1 ~            ; if x1hi or y1 high <> 0 or y1 > 127 then set bit 1 of clipcoord       ; we can optimise this later
 477++CCF1 ~                                    ld      a,h
 478++CCF1 ~                                    or      b
 479++CCF1 ~                                    jr      z,.CheckP1Ylo
 480++CCF1 ~            ;                       iyh     bit 0 - P1 Needs Clipping
 481++CCF1 ~            ;                               bit 1 - P2 Needs Clipping
 482++CCF1 ~            ;                               bit 2 - x1 >= x2 (left to right)
 483++CCF1 ~            ;                               bit 3 - y1 >= y2 (top to bottom)
 484++CCF1 ~            ;                               bit 4 -  DY/DX (steep)
 485++CCF1 ~            .P1OffScreen:           ld      iyh,1                                   ; if either p1 x or y was off screen set bit 0 to 1
 486++CCF1 ~                                    jp      .CheckP2OffScreen                       ; .
 487++CCF1 ~            .CheckP1Ylo:            ld      a,c                                     ; .
 488++CCF1 ~                                    and     $80                                     ; .
 489++CCF1 ~                                    jr      z,.CheckP2OffScreen                     ; .
 490++CCF1 ~                                    ld      iyh,1                                   ; .
 491++CCF1 ~            .CheckP2OffScreen:      ld      a,d                                     ; if x2hi or y2 off screen then set bit 2 of clipcoord to 1
 492++CCF1 ~                                    or      ixh                                     ; .
 493++CCF1 ~                                    jr      z,.CheckP2Ylo                           ; .
 494++CCF1 ~            .P2OffScreen:           ld      a,iyh                                   ; .
 495++CCF1 ~                                    or      2                                       ; .
 496++CCF1 ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ; .
 497++CCF1 ~                                    jp      .CheckXDirection                        ; .
 498++CCF1 ~            .CheckP2Ylo:            ld      a,ixl                                   ; .
 499++CCF1 ~                                    and     $80                                     ; .
 500++CCF1 ~                                    jr      z,.CheckXDirection                      ; .
 501++CCF1 ~                                    ld      a,iyh                                   ; .
 502++CCF1 ~                                    or      2                                       ; .
 503++CCF1 ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ; .
 504++CCF1 ~            .CheckXDirection:       push    de,,hl
 505++CCF1 ~                                    call    CompareHLDESgn                          ; IF HL equals DE, Z=1,C=0, IF HL is less than DE, Z=0,C=1, IF HL is more than DE, Z=0,C=0
 506++CCF1 ~                                    pop     de,,hl
 507++CCF1 ~                                    jp      c,.CalculateDx                          ;
 508++CCF1 ~            .X1gteX2:               ld      a,iyh                                   ; if x1 >= x2 then set bit 3 to denote -ve x direction, note we will eliminate horziontal / vertical early as an optimisation
 509++CCF1 ~                                    or      4                                       ; .
 510++CCF1 ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ; .
 511++CCF1 ~                                    ; Y Direction is now always top to bottom
 512++CCF1 ~            .CalculateDx:           ClearCarryFlag                                  ;                       calculate DX
 513++CCF1 ~                                    sbc     hl,de                                   ; .
 514++CCF1 ~            .ABSDX:                 ld      a,h                                     ; HL = | HL - DE |
 515++CCF1 ~                                    test    $80                                     ; .
 516++CCF1 ~                                    jr      z,.DXPositive                           ; .
 517++CCF1 ~                                    macronegate16hl                                 ; .
 518++CCF1 ~            .DXPositive:            ex      de,hl                                   ; de = abs delta x
 519++CCF1 ~            .CalculateDy:           ClearCarryFlag                                  ; hl = Y2 -Y1 as its pre sorted its always positive if on screen
 520++CCF1 ~                                    ld      hl,ix                                   ; iy = hl = Y2 - Y1
 521++CCF1 ~                                    sbc     hl,bc                                   ; .
 522++CCF1 ~            .DYPositive:            ; Scale DX and DY to 8 bit, by here hl = abs dy, de = abs dx
 523++CCF1 ~            ;calculate DY
 524++CCF1 ~            .ScaleLoop:             ld      a,h                                     ; At this point DX and DY are ABS values
 525++CCF1 ~                                    or      d                                       ; .
 526++CCF1 ~                                    jr      z,.ScaleDone                            ; .
 527++CCF1 ~                                    ShiftDERight1                                   ; .
 528++CCF1 ~                                    ShiftHLRight1                                   ; .
 529++CCF1 ~                                    jr      .ScaleLoop                              ; scaled down Dx and Dy to 8 bit, Dy may have been;;                                                                                               negative
 530++CCF1 ~            .ScaleDone:             ; hl = ABS DY, DE = ABS DX,  bc = Y1, ix = Y2,   note H and D will be zero
 531++CCF1 ~            ; if Dx = 0 then horizontal line and clip X1 & X2 only then exit
 532++CCF1 ~            ; if Dy = 0 then vertical line and clip Y1 & Y2 only then exit
 533++CCF1 ~
 534++CCF1 ~            ; if DX < DY  gradient = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 535++CCF1 ~            ;        else gradient = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo, set bit 5 of clipcord
 536++CCF1 ~            .CalculateDelta:        ld      a,e                                     ; if DX < DY goto DX/DY
 537++CCF1 ~                                    JumpIfALTNusng l,.DXdivDY                       ; else do DY/DX
 538++CCF1 ~            .DYdivDX:               ld      a,l                                     ;    A = DY
 539++CCF1 ~                                    ld      d,e                                     ;    D = DX
 540++CCF1 ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD                         ;    A = R = 256 * DY / DX
 541++CCF1 ~            .SaveGradientDYDX:      ld      (Gradient),a
 542++CCF1 ~                                    ld      a,iyh                                   ;    bit 5 of iyh denotes that its a DX/DY (steep), if its clear its DY/DX (shallow)
 543++CCF1 ~                                    or      16                                      ;    .
 544++CCF1 ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ;    .
 545++CCF1 ~                                    jp      .ClipP1                                 ;    .
 546++CCF1 ~            .DXdivDY:               ld      a,e                                     ;    A = DX
 547++CCF1 ~                                    ld      d,l                                     ;    D = DY
 548++CCF1 ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD                         ;    A = R = 256 * DX / DY
 549++CCF1 ~            .SaveGradientDXDY:      ld      (Gradient),a
 550++CCF1 ~            ; if bit 1 of clipccord is set call    LL118
 551++CCF1 ~            .ClipP1:                ld      a,iyh                                   ; if bit 1 is clear to say no need to clip pont 1 we just jump to point 2
 552++CCF1 ~                                    test    1                                       ; .
 553++CCF1 ~                                    jp      z,.ClipP2                               ; .
 554++CCF1 ~                                    call    LL118v3                                 ; else clip P1 first
 555++CCF1 ~                                    ld      a,b                                     ;      and if b or h have a value its failed to totally clip  as it may be only in bounds on just x or y
 556++CCF1 ~                                    or      h                                       ;      .
 557++CCF1 ~                                    jr      z, .P1Ygt127Check                       ;      .
 558++CCF1 ~            .P1HighOutofBounds:     SetCarryFlag                                    ;      .
 559++CCF1 ~                                    ret                                             ;      .
 560++CCF1 ~            .P1Ygt127Check:         ld      a,c                                     ;      or if y > 127 its failed to totally clip
 561++CCF1 ~                                    test    $80                                     ;      .
 562++CCF1 ~                                    SetCarryFlag                                    ;      .
 563++CCF1 ~                                    ret     nz                                      ;      .
 564++CCF1 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipY1), bc                     ;      else its valid and clipped point 1 so save ti back
 565++CCF1 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipX1), hl
 566++CCF1 ~            ; if bit 2 of clipcoord is set
 567++CCF1 ~            ;        swap x1y1 with x2y2
 568++CCF1 ~            ;        call    LL118
 569++CCF1 ~            .ClipP2:                ld      a,iyh                                   ; so now repeat all that for point 2
 570++CCF1 ~                                    and     2
 571++CCF1 ~                                    jp      z,.ClipComplete
 572++CCF1 ~                                    call    LL118v3PreSwap                          ; now clip p2
 573++CCF1 ~                                    ld      a,b                                     ; if either high is set then it failed to properly clip
 574++CCF1 ~                                    or      h                                       ; .
 575++CCF1 ~                                    jr      z, .P2Ygt127Check                       ; .
 576++CCF1 ~            .P2HighOutofBounds:     SetCarryFlag                                    ; .
 577++CCF1 ~                                    ret                                             ; .
 578++CCF1 ~            .P2Ygt127Check:         ld      a,c                                     ; if c > 127 then it also failed to clip
 579++CCF1 ~                                    test    $80                                     ; .
 580++CCF1 ~                                    SetCarryFlag                                    ; .
 581++CCF1 ~                                    ret     nz                                      ; .
 582++CCF1 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipY2), bc                     ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 583++CCF1 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipX2), hl
 584++CCF1 ~            ;clip compelte exit
 585++CCF1 ~            .ClipComplete:          ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)                      ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 586++CCF1 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)
 587++CCF1 ~                                    ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY2)                      ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 588++CCF1 ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)
 589++CCF1 ~            .SaveClippedLine:       ld      a,c                                     ; Y1 = y1 lo, x2 = x2 lo, x1 = x1 lo y1 = y1 lo                                   -- Nothing off screen
 590++CCF1 ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewY1),a
 591++CCF1 ~                                    ld      a,ixl
 592++CCF1 ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewY2),a
 593++CCF1 ~                                    ld      a,l
 594++CCF1 ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewX1),a
 595++CCF1 ~                                    ld      a,e
 596++CCF1 ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewX2),a
 597++CCF1 ~                                    ClearCarryFlag                              ; we have a success so not carry
 598++CCF1 ~                                    ret
 599++CCF1 ~            ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 600++CCF1 ~            LL118v3PreSwap:         ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY2)                  ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 601++CCF1 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX2)
 602++CCF1 ~                                    jp      LL118v3Fetched
 603++CCF1 ~            ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 604++CCF1 ~            LL118v3:                ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)                  ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 605++CCF1 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)
 606++CCF1 ~            ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 607++CCF1 ~            LL118v3Fetched:
 608++CCF1 ~            ;                       At this point bc = y position, hl = x position both 16 bit
 609++CCF1 ~            ;                       if x < 0 then x = 0
 610++CCF1 ~            ;                                     adjust = -x */ gradient depending on if its steep or shallow
 611++CCF1 ~            ;                                     y = y +- adjust depending on if we are going +ve direction or negative direction  (or simplify it, that it will always be + for x1y1 and - for x2y2 as we pre-sort)
 612++CCF1 ~            ;                       if x > 255 then x = 255
 613++CCF1 ~            ;                                     adjust = x-255 */ gradient
 614++CCF1 ~            ;                                     y = y +- adjust depending on if we are going +ve direction or negative direction  (or simplify it, that it will always be + for x1y1 and - for x2y2 as we pre-sort)
 615++CCF1 ~            ;                       if y < 0 then y = 0
 616++CCF1 ~            ;                                     adjust = -y */ gradient
 617++CCF1 ~            ;                                     x = x +- adjust depending on if we are going left to right or visa versa
 618++CCF1 ~            ;                       if y >127 then y = 127
 619++CCF1 ~            ;                                     adjust = y-127 */ gradient
 620++CCF1 ~            ;                                     x = x +- adjust depending on if we are going left to right or visa versa
 621++CCF1 ~            ;
 622++CCF1 ~            ;                       iyh     bit 0 - P1 Needs Clipping
 623++CCF1 ~            ;                               bit 1 - P2 Needs Clipping
 624++CCF1 ~            ;                               bit 2 - x1 >= x2 (left to right)
 625++CCF1 ~            ;                               bit 3 - y1 >= y2 (top to bottom)
 626++CCF1 ~            ;                               bit 4 -  DY/DX (steep)
 627++CCF1 ~            ; if X1 hi <> 0
 628++CCF1 ~            LL118:                  ;break
 629++CCF1 ~                                    ld      a,h                                     ; if x1 high is 0 then we don't need to clip x at all
 630++CCF1 ~                                    and     a
 631++CCF1 ~                                    jp      z,.X1NoClipNeeded
 632++CCF1 ~            ;                       if x1 hi bit 7 is set (so negative)
 633++CCF1 ~            .CalcBlockX:            test    $80                                     ; if h is postiive then jump to the XPositive Calc block
 634++CCF1 ~                                    jr      z,.CalcBlockXPositive
 635++CCF1 ~            ;                       if clipccord bit 5 is set Adjust = abs(X1) / Gradient (may need to swap bit check?)
 636++CCF1 ~            .CalcBlockXNegative:    ld      a,iyh                                   ;
 637++CCF1 ~                                    test    16                                      ; bit 5 of iyh denotes that its a DY/DX, if its clear its DX/DY
 638++CCF1 ~                                    jr      nz,.CalcBlockXNegMulGrad
 639++CCF1 ~            .CaclBlockXNegDivGrad:  macronegate16hl
 640++CCF1 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)
 641++CCF1 ~                                    push    bc                                      ; abs(X1) / Gradient
 642++CCF1 ~                                    ld      h,c                     ; move offset into high byte of h
 643++CCF1 ~                                    ld      l,0
 644++CCF1 ~                                    ld      c,a
 645++CCF1 ~                                    call    div_hl_c
 646++CCF1 ~                                    pop     bc
 647++CCF1 ~                                    jp      .DoneXNegCalc
 648++CCF1 ~            ;                       else set Adjust = abs(X1) * Gradient
 649++CCF1 ~            .CalcBlockXNegMulGrad:  push    bc                                      ; abs(X1) * Gradient
 650++CCF1 ~                                    macronegate16hl
 651++CCF1 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)
 652++CCF1 ~                                    call    HLeqyHLmulAdiv256
 653++CCF1 ~                                    pop     bc
 654++CCF1 ~            ;                       y1 += adjust * (-1 if bit 4 of clipcoord is set)
 655++CCF1 ~            ;                       x1 = 0 then call into DonrX1Calc
 656++CCF1 ~            ;                       we can skip the test for negative Y direection
 657++CCF1 ~            .DoneXNegCalc:          macronegate16hl
 658++CCF1 ~            .XNegSkipNegate:        ld      de,bc
 659++CCF1 ~                                    ex      hl,de
 660++CCF1 ~                                    add     hl,de
 661++CCF1 ~                                    ld      bc,hl
 662++CCF1 ~                                    ld      hl,0
 663++CCF1 ~                                    jp      .DoneXCalc
 664++CCF1 ~            ;                       else x1 hi is positive
 665++CCF1 ~            ;                       if clipccord bit 5 is set Adjust = X1 lo / Gradient (may need to swap bit check?)
 666++CCF1 ~            .CalcBlockXPositive:    ld      a,iyh
 667++CCF1 ~                                    test    16
 668++CCF1 ~                                    jr      nz,.CalcBlockXPosMulGrad
 669++CCF1 ~            .CalcBlockXPosDivGrad:  ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 670++CCF1 ~                                    push    bc
 671++CCF1 ~                                    ld      c,a
 672++CCF1 ~                                    ld      de,255
 673++CCF1 ~                                    sub     hl,de
 674++CCF1 ~                                    ld      h,l
 675++CCF1 ~                                    ld      l,0
 676++CCF1 ~                                    call    div_hl_c
 677++CCF1 ~                                    pop     bc
 678++CCF1 ~                                    jp      .DoneX2Calc
 679++CCF1 ~            ;                                 else set Adjust = X1 lo * Gradient
 680++CCF1 ~            .CalcBlockXPosMulGrad:  push    bc
 681++CCF1 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 682++CCF1 ~                                    ld      de,255
 683++CCF1 ~                                    sub     hl,de
 684++CCF1 ~                                    call    HLeqyHLmulAdiv256       ; hl = YX = SR / Q
 685++CCF1 ~                                    pop     bc
 686++CCF1 ~            ;                       y1 += adjust * (-1 if bit 4 of clipcoord is set)
 687++CCF1 ~            ;                       x1 = 255
 688++CCF1 ~            ;                       we can skip the test for negative Y direection
 689++CCF1 ~            .DoneX2Calc:            macronegate16hl
 690++CCF1 ~            .X2SkipNegate:          ex      de,hl
 691++CCF1 ~                                    ld      hl,bc
 692++CCF1 ~                                    add     hl,de
 693++CCF1 ~                                    ld      bc,hl
 694++CCF1 ~                                    ld      hl,255
